Class TableFormatter

java.lang.Object
utils.formatter.TableFormatter
public class TableFormatter extends Object
Table formatter utility for consistent table layouts. Provides formatting methods for tables with fixed column widths. No display logic - only formatting operations.
Since:
2025-11-16
Version:
1.0
Author:
NTU SC2002 Group

  • Constructor Details

    • TableFormatter

      public TableFormatter()
      Default constructor for TableFormatter.

  • Method Details

    • getInternshipColumnWidths

      public static int[] getInternshipColumnWidths()
      Gets fixed column widths for internship table without status/visible columns.
      Returns:
      Array of column widths

    • getInternshipColumnWidthsWithStatus

      public static int[] getInternshipColumnWidthsWithStatus()
      Gets fixed column widths for internship table with status/visible/pending columns.
      Returns:
      Array of column widths

    • getApplicationColumnWidths

      public static int[] getApplicationColumnWidths()
      Gets fixed column widths for application table. Order: #, ID, Student ID, Student, Internship, Company, Status, Date.
      Returns:
      Array of column widths

    • getColumnWidths

      public static int[] getColumnWidths(String[] headers)
      Get fixed column widths based on headers (for custom tables). Returns predefined widths if headers match known patterns, otherwise calculates.
      Parameters:
      headers - the table headers
      Returns:
      array of column widths

    • formatTable

      public static String formatTable(String[] headers, List<String[]> rows)
      Formats a table with headers and rows using fixed column widths.
      Parameters:
      headers - Column headers
      rows - List of data rows (each row is an array of strings)
      Returns:
      Formatted table string with borders

    • formatRow

      private static String formatRow(String[] row, int[] columnWidths)
      Formats a single table row with proper column widths and alignment. Pads each cell to its column width and adds spacing between columns.
      Parameters:
      row - The row data as array of strings
      columnWidths - The column widths to use for each cell
      Returns:
      Formatted row string with newline

    • drawBorder

      private static String drawBorder(int[] columnWidths)
      Draws a horizontal border line using dashes. Calculates total width based on column widths plus spacing.
      Parameters:
      columnWidths - Array of column widths
      Returns:
      Border string of repeated dashes

    • adjustColumnWidthsForData

      private static void adjustColumnWidthsForData(String[] headers, List<String[]> rows, int[] columnWidths)
      Adjusts fixed column widths based on actual data. Maintains minimum fixed widths but expands if data is longer. Caps maximum width at 80 characters to prevent excessive expansion. Modifies columnWidths array in place.
      Parameters:
      headers - The column headers
      rows - The data rows
      columnWidths - The column widths array to adjust (modified in place)

    • calculateColumnWidths

      private static int[] calculateColumnWidths(String[] headers, List<String[]> rows)
      Calculates optimal column widths for custom tables. Fallback method when predefined fixed widths are not available. Ensures minimum widths for first two columns (# and ID).
      Parameters:
      headers - The column headers
      rows - The data rows (can be null for header-only calculation)
      Returns:
      Array of calculated column widths

    • truncateCell

      private static String truncateCell(String cell, int maxWidth)
      Truncates cell content if it exceeds maximum width. Adds "..." ellipsis suffix to indicate truncation.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell content to truncate
      maxWidth - The maximum width allowed
      Returns:
      Truncated cell content with ellipsis if needed, original content otherwise
